I am praying for the Chiscano family during this difficult time. He will be greatly missed. https://www.ksat.com/news/father-of-sa-tricentennial-celebration-dies …

Dr. Alfonso "Chico" Chiscano, surgeon and co-chair of SA Tricentennial, passed away on Tuesday. He was a great historian who dedicated his time and efforts to preserving our community’s heritage. He was also the first person to perform open-heart surgery in the Canary Islands.

You’re right, Latinos are underrepresented across industries. But Hollywood is arguably the most damaging because it shapes perceptions of groups in American society. 

Engineers don’t do that. https://twitter.com/ElMeroSabroso/status/1166088548782657537 …

Hollywood also shuts out Latinos — as actors, directors, producers, guild members, etc. And, from what I can tell, hardly anyone in power over there seems to care much. 

“Liberal” Hollywood is exclusionary and a big part of the reason for misunderstandings about Latinos.
I’m not running for president. I support net neutrality, however. https://twitter.com/CommonCause/status/1166074768224915457 …

One fact from @Inclusionists Hollywood study: 28% of Latino lead and co-lead roles were criminal characters.

Hollywood misrepresents Latinos.

Sadly, it’s done as much damage to Americans’ perceptions of Latinos as anything you see on Fox News at night or hear at a Trump rally. https://twitter.com/REMEZCLA/status/1166046016921100299 …
